definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: Yan Jing Ke suspected Prince an excuse to delay repeatedly urged innuendo .
sentences.chinese: 燕太子怀疑荆轲借故拖延，多次暗讽催促。

sentences.english: Every time I ask her to set the date she stalls.
sentences.chinese: 我每次请她定一个时间，她总是借故拖延。

sentences.english: No matter how, excuse a person be forgiven for not always fall.
sentences.chinese: 无论怎么样，一个人借故堕落总是不值得原谅的。

sentences.english: Going to other place to work using sick leave.
sentences.chinese: 借故请病假往他处工作者。

sentences.english: Every time I ask her to set date she stalls.
sentences.chinese: 我每滴请她定一各时间，她总饲借故拖矣。

sentences.english: That person looked budda to win, to sneak away, the wc on find an excuse.
sentences.chinese: 那人一看佛祖赢了，向溜之大吉，便借故上wc。

sentences.english: The night before the wedding, I decided to call my friends and beg off.
sentences.chinese: 在婚礼前的晚上，我决定借故推辞我朋友的邀请。

sentences.english: After knowing someone in your company likes you, he will come to pick you up after work.
sentences.chinese: 他知道公司有人追求你后，会借故到你公司楼下接你。

sentences.english: Wen An tries to leave his mobile phone at the Zhangs but gets found out.
sentences.chinese: 文安到张家借故留下手机，却被发现。

definition: to plead/to claim as an excuse
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to send sb away (with an excuse)
to leave in stealth/to slip away
lit. twice then three times (idiom); fig. repeatedly/over and over again
to absent oneself from a meeting/to decline to attend
